You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Allow Buyers to Select Multiple Filter Values Per Spec

By default, a buyer can select only one value per spec in the Filter Featuring widget. To give buyers more flexibility for applying filter criteria and discovering the right products, enable join filtering, which allows multiple selected values per spec.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

Let's say that two specs are available for filtering on the Product List page: Material and Grade. The buyer first selects a value for the Material spec, Stainless Steel, which applies that filter to the results on the Product List page. The first spec selected becomes the primary filter, which determines what other filterable values are available.

When join filtering is disabled (default)
The buyer can't select any other values for the primary filter—the Material spec.
The buyer can also select a value for a secondary filter—the Grade spec—which further refines the results on the Product List page. But, the only values still selectable—Personal and Commercial—are those values that also apply to products where the Material spec is Stainless Steel.

With this experience, the results on the page always match all selected filters. But, the buyer is limited to selecting only one value per spec at one time.

When join filtering is enabled
The buyer can still select other values for the primary filter—the Material spec—such as Glass.
The buyer can also select values for a secondary filter—the Grade spec. The selectable values apply to products where the Material spec can be either Stainless Steel or Glass.

The buyer has more flexibility to select multiple values per spec. The results on the page can sometimes match only some selected filters, not all.

WARNING This experience allows a buyer to change which values are selected for the primary filter after they've selected values for a secondary filter. In this scenario, the Product List page can sometimes show an error that no products match the combination of selected filters.

To enable join filtering, update your storefront configuration settings.

On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Feature Filtering (3).
Find the Join Filtering configuration (4), and check its value (5).
If the value is TRUE, this setting is already enabled on your storefront. Skip the remaining steps.
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Feature Filtering
Configuration	Join Filtering
Page	PLP
Value	TRUE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

title: Enabling Join Filtering on B2B Commerce for Visualforce
